votingsystems

Class IRV

  • java.lang.Object
    • votingsystems.VotingSystem
      • votingsystems.IRV

  • public class IRV
extends VotingSystem
    Represents an Instant Runoff Voting System.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private IRVBallot[] ballots
      The ballots being cast in the election.
      private IRVCandidate[] candidates
      The candidates participating in the election.
      private boolean resultsGUI
      Indicates if the results should be output to the GUI.
      private IRVBallot[] voterPool
      Stores the ballots currently being processed in the initial allocation of votes or in a redistribution of votes for a runoff.

        auditor, numBallots, numCandidates, quota, wasRun

      • IRV

        public IRV(int numBallots,
           int numCandidates,
           java.lang.String[] candidates,
           java.util.LinkedList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> ballots,
           boolean resultsGUI)
        Instantiates a new instant runoff voting system.
        Parameters:
        numBallots - the number of ballots in the election
        numCandidates - the number of candidates in the election
        candidates - the candidates running in the election
        ballots - the ballots being cast in the election
        resultsGUI - indicator for whether the results should be displaying using the gui

      • IRV

        public IRV()
        Throws an error for default constructor.

    • Method Detail

      • calculateQuota

        private void calculateQuota(int numBallots)
        Determines the quota to be guaranteed a win in the election and stores it in a private variable. The quota is a majority greater than 50%.
        Parameters:
        numBallots - the number of ballots cast in the election

      • eliminateAllNoVoteCandidates

        private void eliminateAllNoVoteCandidates()
        Eliminate all candidates who received no votes.

      • findMinimumCandidate

        private IRVCandidate findMinimumCandidate()
        Find the candidate who received the least amount of votes after the initial election process or during a runoff.
        Returns:
        the IRV candidate

      • isMajority

        private boolean isMajority(int numVotes)
        Used to check if a candidate has received enough votes for a majority.
        Parameters:
        numVotes - the number of votes the candidate has received.
        Returns:
        true, if is majority

      • processVoterPool

        private java.lang.String processVoterPool()
        Processes the current voter pool in the running of an election.
        Returns:
        the name of the candidate who has received a majority of votes otherwise an empty string if no winner has been tabulated.

      • runElection

        public java.lang.String runElection()
                             throws java.io.IOException
        Description copied from class: VotingSystem
